metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31129 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
moment is a JavaScript date library for parsing, validating, manipulating,and formatting dates. Affected versions of moment were found to use aninefficient parsing algorithm. Specifically using string-to-date parsing inmoment (more specifically rfc2822 parsing, which is tried by default) hasquadratic (N^2) complexity on specific inputs. Users may notice anoticeable slowdown is observed with inputs above 10k characters. Users whopass user-provided strings without sanity length checks to momentconstructor are vulnerable to (Re)DoS attacks. The problem is patched in2.29.4, the patch can be applied to all affected versions with minimaltweaking. Users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade shouldconsider limiting date lengths accepted from user input.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31129` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-moment - 2.29.1+ds-3ubuntu0.2
node-moment - 2.29.1+ds-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-moment package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.29.1+ds-3ubuntu0.2').
wordpress package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mediawiki package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
syncthing package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
omnidb package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
postfixadmin package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
ruby-momentjs-rails package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
sabnzbdplus package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
gnucash package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
ntopng package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
odoo package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
